events.originalText: The NASA spacecraft MAVEN entered into orbit around Mars to study the planet's atmosphere.
events.subtitle: NASA
events.headline: NASA spacecraft MAVEN enters Mars orbit for atmospheric study

events.originalText: Insurgency in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: All Saints Church in Peshawar, Pakistan, was attacked by two suicide bombers who killed 127 people.
events.subtitle: Insurgency in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa
events.headline: 127 killed in All Saints Church attack in Peshawar, Pakistan

events.originalText: Dolphin, the first emulator for the GameCube that could run commercial video games, was released.
events.subtitle: Dolphin (emulator)
events.headline: First GameCube emulator Dolphin released

events.originalText: The Nordhordland Bridge, crossing Salhusfjorden between Klauvaneset and Flatøy in Vestland, and Norway's second-longest bridge, officially opened.
events.subtitle: Nordhordland Bridge
events.headline: Nordhordland Bridge officially opens in Vestland, Norway

events.originalText: A tugboat towing a barge collided with a rail bridge in Mobile, Alabama, U.S., deforming the tracks and causing the derailment of a passenger train eight minutes later, which killed 47 people and injured an additional 103.
events.subtitle: Tugboat
events.headline: Tugboat collision leads to train derailment in Mobile, Alabama, killing 47

events.originalText: An American Vela satellite detected an unidentified flash of light near the Prince Edward Islands in the Indian Ocean, thought to be a nuclear weapons test.
events.subtitle: Vela (satellite)
events.headline: Unidentified flash near Prince Edward Islands detected by American Vela satellite

events.originalText: Sara Jane Moore attempted to assassinate U.S. president Gerald Ford, but failed due to unfamiliarity with her weapon.
events.subtitle: Sara Jane Moore
events.headline: Sara Jane Moore fails in attempt to assassinate U.S. president Gerald Ford

events.originalText: François Duvalier (pictured), nicknamed Papa Doc, was elected President of Haiti as a populist before consolidating power and ruling as a dictator for the rest of his life.
events.subtitle: François Duvalier
events.headline: François Duvalier elected President of Haiti, later ruling as dictator

events.originalText: Led by Gail Halvorsen, the United States Air Force began Operation "Little Vittles", delivering candy to children as part of the Berlin Airlift.
events.subtitle: Gail Halvorsen
events.headline: Operation 'Little Vittles' begins candy deliveries to Berlin children

events.originalText: A joint military parade by the troops of Nazi Germany and the Soviet Union took place in Brest-Litovsk to celebrate their partition of Poland.
events.subtitle: German–Soviet military parade in Brest-Litovsk
events.headline: Nazi Germany and Soviet Union troops hold joint military parade in Brest-Litovsk

events.originalText: One of Britain's worst mining accidents took place when an explosion at Gresford Colliery in Wales killed 266 men.
events.subtitle: Gresford disaster
events.headline: Explosion at Gresford Colliery in Wales kills 266 miners

events.originalText: After nine days, the great fire of Smyrna was extinguished , having caused at least ten thousand deaths.
events.subtitle: Burning of Smyrna
events.headline: Great fire of Smyrna extinguished after ten thousand deaths

events.originalText: First World War: The German submarine U-9 sank three Royal Navy cruisers, resulting in approximately 1,450 deaths.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: German submarine U-9 sinks three Royal Navy cruisers in First World War

events.originalText: World War I: German naval forces bombarded Papeete in French Polynesia.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: German naval forces bombard Papeete in French Polynesia during World War I

events.originalText: Das Rheingold, the first of four operas in Der Ring des Nibelungen by the German composer Richard Wagner (pictured), was first performed in Munich.
events.subtitle: Das Rheingold
events.headline: Richard Wagner's opera Das Rheingold first performed in Munich

events.originalText: The office of United States Postmaster General was formally established.
events.subtitle: United States Postmaster General
events.headline: United States Postmaster General office formally established

events.originalText: Eighty Years' War: Spanish forces defeated an Anglo-Dutch army at the Battle of Zutphen.
events.subtitle: Eighty Years' War
events.headline: Spanish forces defeat Anglo-Dutch army at Battle of Zutphen in Eighty Years' War

events.originalText: Livonian Crusade: The Livonian Brothers of the Sword were soundly defeated by pagan Samogitian and Semigallian troops at the Battle of Saule.
events.subtitle: Livonian Crusade
events.headline: Livonian Brothers of the Sword defeated by pagan troops at Battle of Saule
